Detailed Description

Centralized logging and files management.

This class is a core component on TREX logging and file management. It provides a transparent one-stop shopping to :

  • Locate and load files
  • produce text log messages toward a singfle log directory This class manages in a cntral way all this while ensuring that files that are used by an agent are easily accessed and stored in a single log directory giving the ability to knbow exactly what files were used on a specific run.

It provides utilities that will create a log directory and the default TextLog file so other components can produce messages seamlessly.

It gives information of the user selected verbosity level which can then be used by other components to identify whether they should log this message or not.

It also provide a way to put all the configurations files used by the program in a specific directory.

This class is a pure singleton and consequently its access should be done using SingletonUse : 

 #include "LogManager.hh"

 TREX::utils::SingletonUse<TREX::utils::LogManager> log;

 log->syslog("me")<<"A message to the log"<<std::endl;
Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

Member Function Documentation

bool LogManager::addSearchPath ( std::string const &  path  ) 

add a directory to the search path

Parameters:
path A directory

This method adds path to the end of the search path. It will do so only if path is a valid directory or is starting with '.'

Return values:
true if path was successfully added
false otherwise
Postcondition:
if the returned value is true path is now part of the serch path
See also:
std::string locate(std::string const &file, bool &found) const

Definition at line 252 of file LogManager.hh.

std::string LogManager::locate ( std::string const &  file,
bool &  found 
) const

Locate a file.

Parameters:
[in] file A file name
[out] found Indicator of success/failure

This methods tries to locate file in the search path. it first attempt to see if file exists by its own. If it is not the case and file do not starts with a '/', it iterates through the search path and tries to locate the file.

Return values:
@p file if found is false which indicates that it was unable to locate this file
A valid symbolic name for file if found is true
See also:
bool addSearchPath(std::string const &path)
std::string use(std::string const &, bool &)

Definition at line 277 of file LogManager.cc.

std::string LogManager::use ( std::string const &  file_name,
bool &  found 
)

Configuration files management.

Parameters:
[in] file_name A configuration file name
[out] found Indicate if the file was found

This method is used to indicate that file_name has been used. It copies this file into the cfg subdirectory of the log directory.

If the file file_name cannot be found it also display a message in the log file.

Note:
This function uses locate method to look for the file in the current directory and the search path
Exceptions:
ErrnoExcept A problem occured while trying to copy file
ErrnoExcept A problem occured while trying to create log directory
Returns:
A complete name of file_name along with the path where it was located
See also:
logPath()
file_name(std::string const &)
std::string locate(std::string const &, bool &) const

Friends And Related Function Documentation

LATEST_DIR [related]

Name of the symbolic link to "latest" logs.

This macro gives the name to give to the symbolic link that will be created in the log directory to point to the logs of the latest/current session

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

Definition at line 106 of file LogManager.hh.

LOG_DIR_ENV [related]

log directory environment variable

This macro gives the name of the environment variable to read for knowing in what path the log files should be placed.

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

Definition at line 96 of file LogManager.hh.

MAX_LOG_ATTEMPT [related]

Maximum log directory creation attempts.

This macro indicates how much attempt to create a new log directory should be done before giving up and generating an error.

Note:
This value do not mean that TREX can only execute up to MAX_LOG_ATTEMPT missions in a single day. Ifndeed if one look at the code of LogManager::createLatest he will see that it makes this number of attempt stariung from the directory referred by LATEST_DIR link. Such behavior should really happen if the symbolic link LATEST_DIR is not set properly.
Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

Definition at line 122 of file LogManager.hh.

SEARCH_ENV [related]

Search path environment variable.

The name of the environment variable that indicates where TREX can search for files to locate them. The format fro this variable is a list of directories separated by a column (':')

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>
See also:
LogManager::m_searchPath

Definition at line 86 of file LogManager.hh.

TREX_ENV [related]

Home environment variable.

The name of the environment variable that indicates where TREX is located. If valid, the value of this variable will be automatically added to the search path used by LogManager to locate new files

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>
See also:
LogManager::m_searchPath

TREX_LOG_FILE [related]

TREX default log file name.

This macro is used by LogManager. It gives the name of the log file to create for logging text messages.

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>
